moves.1. d4: I open with the solid queen's pawn opening.
moves.1... Nf6 2. c4: Surprise!I usually play 2.Nf3 or 2.e3 for a stonewall.I said no more sidelines!I will ride the tiger...
moves.3. Nc3 d5: The move that distinguishes the Gruenfeld.
moves.4. Bf4: 4.cxd5 and 4.Nf3 are also good,but this move suits my style.
moves.5... dxc4: ?! from a psychological standpoint this move is bad.Black plays the Gruenfeld just to play like a QGA.
moves.6. Bxc4 O-O: ? A bad mistake! 6...c5 is better.7.dxc5 Qa5 with Nf6-e4 threatened,but White would still have a slight advantage
moves.7. Nf3 Bg4: too late is 7...c5 since 8.dxc5 Qa5 9.O-O Black has lost the sting of ...Ne4
moves.8. Qb3: !? White takes advantage of the LSB departure.
moves.8... Bxf3 9. gxf3 b6: Now White has created a weakness in Black's queenside
moves.11. O-O: A nuance would be exposed after 11.Bd5? c6 12.Bxb8 cxd5 13.Bxa7?? because of 13...Nd6! with a material advantage
moves.11... Nc6 12. Rac1: 12.Bd5? Na5! looks pretty nasty.This preps for a combination...
moves.12... Qd7: ?? the decisive mistake.Itis hard to suggest any productive moves in Black's position though.Maybe best is 12...Rc8 but after 13.Na3 White still looks better.

gameName: What not to do in the gruenfeld
